conclusion: Objects A and B, each with a mass of 1 kg, are attached to the two ends of a massless string. The string passes over a fixed pulley at the top of an inclined plane with an angle of 37°, which is fixed on a horizontal ground. Initially, object B is pulled to the bottom of the inclined plane, while object A is at a height of 1 m above the ground. Friction between B and the inclined plane, as well as between the string and the pulley, is negligible. The system is released from rest and allowed to move. The connection between object B and the string breaks at the moment object A hits the ground.
Object A is at a height of 1 m above the ground, and object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane.
